response_parsed.title: Observing Data Pipelines Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to monitor and visualize data pipelines in real-time using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI's built-in features allow for easy monitoring and debugging of your data pipelines.
Real-time visualization can be achieved by implementing WebSocket support in FastAPI.
Utilize third-party libraries like Plotly Graph SDK or Streamlit to create interactive visualizations within the API.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import WebSocket, FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
socket = WebSocket(app)
# handle data pipeline events and send updates via socket.send_text

import plotly.graph_objects as go
# create interactive visualizations using Plotly Graph SDK

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using the latest features and improvements of FastAPI.
FastAPI supports WebSocket out-of-the-box, enabling real-time data streaming.
caveats: Ensure your system has the necessary dependencies installed (e.g., FastAPI, uvicorn, aiofiles, websockets).
Managing and scaling multiple WebSocket connections may require additional considerations for performance optimization.
